intro: Roessleria gorterioides subsp. aizoides, commonly known as the Aizoides roessleria, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in cool and humid conditions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to cream in color, and it produces small, elongated fruits known as cypsela. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
